DOC.brief_summary: This NIS is a multi-centre, observational, descriptive, cross-sectional study including all consecutive patients with Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS) and a single-arm, prospective, longitudinal cohort study which will include patients hospitalized for ACS and who are with ticagrelor on discharge from hospital.
DOC.brief_title: RuSsian RegisTry of Acute CoronaRy SyndromE TreAtMent and Approach in Dual Antiplatelet Therapy
DOC.criteria: Part A,B: Subjects whose data have been entered in the Russian ACS Registry PART A,B: Discharged from hospital after MI with STsegment elevation (STEMI), MI NST segment elevation (NSTEMI) or Unstable angina. Hospitalized during 24 hours of ACS symptoms onset Part B: Patients on ticagrelor at the time of discharge from hospital The existence of serious / severe concomitant diseases which can in the short term (i.e. within 6 months) limit the duration of life Current participation in a clinical trial with a nonlicensed investigational medicinal product
